Package us.ihmc.euclid.rotationConversion

Class RotationVectorConversion

  • java.lang.Object
    • us.ihmc.euclid.rotationConversion.RotationVectorConversion
  • public abstract class RotationVectorConversion
extends java.lang.Object
    This class gathers all the methods necessary to converts any type of rotation into a rotation vector.

    WARNING: a rotation vector is different from a yaw-pitch-roll or Euler angles representation. A rotation vector is equivalent to the axis of an axis-angle that is multiplied by the angle of the same axis-angle.

    To convert an orientation into other data structure types see:

    • for axis-angle: AxisAngleConversion,
    • for quaternion: QuaternionConversion,
    • for rotation matrix: RotationMatrixConversion,
    • for yaw-pitch-roll: YawPitchRollConversion.

    Author:
    Sylvain Bertrand

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static double EPS
      Tolerance used to identify various edge cases, such as to identify when an axis-angle represents a zero orientation.

    • Method Detail

      • convertAxisAngleToRotationVector

        public static void convertAxisAngleToRotationVector​(AxisAngleReadOnly axisAngle,
                                                    Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given axis-angle into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the axis-angle and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either component of the axis-angle is Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.
        • if the length of the axis is below EPS, the rotation vector is set to zero.

        Parameters:
        axisAngle - the axis-angle to use for the conversion. Not modified.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertAxisAngleToRotationVectorImpl

        public static void convertAxisAngleToRotationVectorImpl​(double ux,
                                                        double uy,
                                                        double uz,
                                                        double angle,
                                                        Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given axis-angle into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the axis-angle and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either component of the axis-angle is Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.
        • if the length of the axis is below EPS, the rotation vector is set to zero.

        Parameters:
        ux - the axis x-component of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        uy - the axis y-component of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        uz - the axis z-component of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        angle - the angle of the axis-angle to use for the conversion.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertQuaternionToRotationVector

        public static void convertQuaternionToRotationVector​(QuaternionReadOnly quaternion,
                                                     Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given quaternion into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the quaternion and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either component of the quaternion is Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.
        • if the norm of the quaternion is below EPS, the rotation vector is set to zero.

        Parameters:
        quaternion - the quaternion to use for the conversion. Not modified.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertMatrixToRotationVector

        public static void convertMatrixToRotationVector​(RotationScaleMatrixReadOnly rotationScaleMatrix,
                                                 Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the rotation part of the given rotation-scale matrix into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the rotation matrix and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation matrix contains at least one Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        rotationScaleMatrix - a 3-by-3 matrix representing an orientation and a scale. Only the orientation part is used during the conversion. Not modified.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertMatrixToRotationVector

        public static void convertMatrixToRotationVector​(RotationMatrixReadOnly rotationMatrix,
                                                 Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given rotation matrix into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the rotation matrix and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation matrix contains at least one Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        rotationMatrix - a 3-by-3 matrix representing an orientation. Not modified.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertMatrixToRotationVectorImpl

        static void convertMatrixToRotationVectorImpl​(double m00,
                                              double m01,
                                              double m02,
                                              double m10,
                                              double m11,
                                              double m12,
                                              double m20,
                                              double m21,
                                              double m22,
                                              Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given rotation matrix into a rotation vector.

        This method is for internal use. Use convertMatrixToRotationVector(RotationMatrixReadOnly, Vector3DBasics) or convertMatrixToRotationVector(RotationScaleMatrixReadOnly, Vector3DBasics) instead.

        After calling this method, the rotation matrix and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if the rotation matrix contains at least one Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.

        Parameters:
        m00 - the new 1st row 1st column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m01 - the new 1st row 2nd column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m02 - the new 1st row 3rd column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m10 - the new 2nd row 1st column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m11 - the new 2nd row 2nd column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m12 - the new 2nd row 3rd column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m20 - the new 3rd row 1st column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m21 - the new 3rd row 2nd column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        m22 - the new 3rd row 3rd column coefficient for the matrix to use for the conversion.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertYawPitchRollToRotationVector

        public static void convertYawPitchRollToRotationVector​(double[] yawPitchRoll,
                                                       Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given yaw-pitch-roll angles into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the yaw-pitch-roll and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either of the yaw, pitch, or roll angle is Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.

        Note: the yaw-pitch-roll representation, also called Euler angles, corresponds to the representation of an orientation by decomposing it by three successive rotations around the three axes: Z (yaw), Y (pitch), and X (roll). The equivalent rotation matrix of such representation is:
        R = RZ(yaw) * RY(pitch) * RX(roll)

        Parameters:
        yawPitchRoll - the yaw-pitch-roll angles to use in the conversion. Not modified.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.

      • convertYawPitchRollToRotationVector

        public static void convertYawPitchRollToRotationVector​(double yaw,
                                                       double pitch,
                                                       double roll,
                                                       Vector3DBasics rotationVectorToPack)
        Converts the given yaw-pitch-roll angles into a rotation vector.

        After calling this method, the yaw-pitch-roll and the rotation vector represent the same orientation.

        Edge case:

        • if either of the yaw, pitch, or roll angle is Double.NaN, the rotation vector is set to Double.NaN.

        Note: the yaw-pitch-roll representation, also called Euler angles, corresponds to the representation of an orientation by decomposing it by three successive rotations around the three axes: Z (yaw), Y (pitch), and X (roll). The equivalent rotation matrix of such representation is:
        R = RZ(yaw) * RY(pitch) * RX(roll)

        Parameters:
        yaw - the yaw angle to use in the conversion.
        pitch - the pitch angle to use in the conversion.
        roll - the roll angle to use in the conversion.
        rotationVectorToPack - the vector in which the result is stored. Modified.
